name: 書報討論－科技應用管理（四）
description:
	The objective of goals：
1.	To provide the latest professional knowledge in technological application management and enhance the level of research.
2.	To discuss the professional method of research and help students do research.

	Learning Materials:
We’ll offer given reading materials in the course.

	Grading:
1.	Paper Presentation:  50%
Every student should present papers in the semester.
2.	Class Participation:  50%
goals: 瞭解全球科技管理研究與理論之最新發展
syllabus:
The course aims to help Management of Technology (MOT) major students understand the most up-to-date trends of MOT research through reviews and presentations of selected papers from the leading SSCI indexed journals being listed below:

1.          Cunningham, S.W., Kwakkel, J., 2011. Innovation forecasting: A case study of the management of engineering and technology literature. Technological Forecasting and Social Change 78, 346-357.

2.          Dangelico, R.M., Garavelli, A.C., Petruzzelli, A.M., 2010. A system dynamics model to analyze technology districts\` evolution in a knowledge-based perspective. Technovation 30, 142-153.

3.          Dijk, M., Yarime, M., 2010. The emergence of hybrid-electric cars: Innovation path creation through co-evolution of supply and demand. Technological Forecasting and Social Change 77, 1371-1390.

4.          Järvenpää, H.M., Mäkinen, S.J., Seppänen, M., 2011. Patent and publishing activity sequence over a technology\`s life cycle. Technological Forecasting and Social Change 78, 283-293.

5.          Phaal, R., O\`Sullivan, E., Routley, M., Ford, S., Probert, D., 2011. A framework for mapping industrial emergence. Technological Forecasting and Social Change 78, 217-230.

6.          Ringland, G., 2010. The role of scenarios in strategic foresight. Technological Forecasting and Social Change 77, 1493-1498.

7.          Sørensen, F., Mattsson, J., Sundbo, J., 2010. Experimental methods in innovation research. Research Policy 39, 313-322.

8.          Samila, S., Sorenson, O., 2010. Venture capital as a catalyst to commercialization. Research Policy 39, 1348-1360.

9.          Shin, J., Park, Y., Evolutionary optimization of a technological knowledge network. Technovation 30, 612-626.

10.      Tran, Y., Hsuan, J., Mahnke, V., 2011. How do innovation intermediaries add value? Insight from new product development in fashion markets. R&D Management 41, 80-91.

11.      Wang, C.-H., Chin, Y.-C., Tzeng, G.-H., Mining the R&D innovation performance processes for high-tech firms based on rough set theory. Technovation 30, 447-458.
